column4: anyone can tell me what's wrong on my grup? check http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/2430/ and http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/2431/ please
that means grub cant find a partition that is readable by grub.
have you check my 2 links about fstab and fdisk?
myeah.. glanced at them. looks okay to me. if the information is correct that is.
take a look in your bios, and make sure your discs are set to AUTO.
is better load default option of bios?

you probably have the option to set up where your discs actually are mounted in your computer. And those settings usually override how they actually are setup. and that could cause problems.. perhaps a long shot, i dont know.
thanks dude, I've fix my problem, I load default setup, now all is ok
I'm so curious to know what's in my bios was wrong to hang up grub
hmm.. myeah. sometimes when the discs are set to a user defined value instead of AUTO bootloaders get confused.
might have been something like that.
